nodes.documentation:
@dev transfers tokens held by timelock to beneficiary.
@notice resets beneficiary balance after tokens are released
nodes.name: release

devdoc.details: the contract responsible for locking tokens for them to be sent after a defined amount of time has elapsed

balanceOf(address).details: return the amount of token funds locked for a certain beneficiary

funds().details: return the amount of token funds in the smart contract

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

lock(address,uint256,uint256).details: lock an amount of tokens for a beneficiary for them to be released at a later point in the future

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

release(address).details: transfers tokens held by timelock to beneficiary.

releaseTimeOf(address).details: return the time to release token funds locked for a certain beneficiary

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.

devdoc.title: Timelock

deposit(uint256).notice: deposited tokens are added to the non-locked token funds

lock(address,uint256,uint256).notice: when locking funds for the same user multiple times, it adds to the already locked amounts and uses the last release time defined

release(address).notice: resets beneficiary balance after tokens are released

userdoc.notice: the contract is ownable, meaning only the owner of the smart contract can run the core functionality. it is also pausable, meaning the owner could put the work of the smart contract into a halt in case of emergencies
